text: Giorgio Nicodemi ( Trieste, 9 May, 1891 - Milan, 9 June, 1967) was an Italian art historian, critic. He graduated from the Scientific-Literary Academy of Milan. Giorgio Nicodemi was Professor of Art History at the Catholic University of Milan. From 1919 he was President of the Tosio Martinengo Gallery Museum and since 1923 of the Civic Museums of Brescia. He is the author of the magazines Emporio, Dedalo and Rivista dell'Arte. == Publications == * Saggio su Francesco Filippini, Milan, 1933. * La pittura milanese dell'età neoclassica, Alfieri e Lacroix, Milano, 1915 ISBN IT\ICCU\LO1\0355620 * I disegni della Pinacoteca Bresciana Tosio e Martinengo, litografica bresciana, Brescia, 1921, ISBN IT\ICCU\TO0\0742266 * Tranquillo Cremona, Mondadori, Milano, 1933, ISBN=IT\ICCU\NAP\0084510 * Dipinti di Francesco Hayez, 1934, ISBN IT\ICCU\IEI\0225823 * Leonardo anatomico, Tipografia Luigi Niccolai, Firenze, 1937, ISBN IT\ICCU\LO1\0780084 * Leonardo Bazzaro, Ariel, Milano, 1938, ISBN IT\ICCU\LO1\0769090 * Angelo Inganni, Libreria lombarda, Milano, 1942, ISBN IT\ICCU\LO1\0507046 * I dipinti di Mosè Bianchi posseduti dal Comune di Milano. Catalogo della mostra, Ariel, Milano, 1942, ISBN IT\ICCU\CUB\0101486 * Hokusai, Milano, G. G. Gorlich, 1945, ISBN IT\ICCU\RAV\0266193 * Emilio Gola, 1851-1923, curator Remo Taccani, Edizioni della Permanente, Milano, 1956, ISBN IT\ICCU\CUB\0319080 * La pittura italiana dell'Ottocento a Villa Godi Valmarana, ORGA, Milano, 1966, ISBN IT\ICCU\CFI\0453569 ==References== Category:Italian art critics Category:Italian historians Category:Art historians Category:1891 births Category:1967 deaths Category:People from Trieste
title: Giorgio Nicodemi
